messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Geoducks
messages.msgSnippet: OMG ... this is WONDERFUL!!!  I ve never laughed so hard in my life, thanks for sending this David!!!  and the fight song is too funny!!!  and goodness, the
messages.messageBody:
OMG ... this is WONDERFUL!!! I've never laughed so hard in my life, thanks
for sending this David!!! and the fight song is too funny!!! and goodness,
the picture of that big ole Geoduck is GROSS!!! :P

Pris ~> still chuckling :D


----- Original Message -----
From: David Albert <shantinik@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 21, 2000 11:01 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Geoducks


> The world's largest clam
>
> http://www.olywa.net/cook/faq.htm
>
> (has a great picture)
>
> Here's the fight song for the local college: (Evergreen State)
>
> Go Geoducks go
> Through the mud and the sand
> let's go
> Siphon high, squirt it out,
> swivel all about,
> let it all hang out.
>
> Go Geoducks go
> Stretch your necks
> When the tide is low
> Siphon high, squirt it out,
> swivel all about,
> let it all hang out.
>
> David
>
> Pris wrote:
>
> > ok, I'll go for it ~> David, what'z a *goeduck*??? I'm sure it's
something
> > really obvious to you Washtonians <G> ...
> >
> > Pris
> > > Lots of unschoolers, eclectics, and generally uppity homeschoolers in
this
> > area.
> > > (Olympia, Washington -- home of the famous Olympia Oyster and the
> > goeduck!)
> > >
> > > david

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Geoducks
messages.msgSnippet: The world s largest clam http://www.olywa.net/cook/faq.htm (has a great picture) Here s the fight song for the local college: (Evergreen State) Go Geoducks go
messages.messageBody:
The world's largest clam

http://www.olywa.net/cook/faq.htm

(has a great picture)

Here's the fight song for the local college: (Evergreen State)

Go Geoducks go
Through the mud and the sand
let's go
Siphon high, squirt it out,
swivel all about,
let it all hang out.

Go Geoducks go
Stretch your necks
When the tide is low
Siphon high, squirt it out,
swivel all about,
let it all hang out.

David

Pris wrote:

> ok, I'll go for it ~> David, what'z a *goeduck*??? I'm sure it's something
> really obvious to you Washtonians <G> ...
>
> Pris
>

> > > I live in the south,southern Va.There are a a few unschoolers in the
> > > area,not too close to where I am.Mostly down here they are Christian
> > > homeschoolers who have very strict school at home.In Richmond or
> > > Charlottesville I am sure there are many more homeschoolers...Deb in Va
> > >
> > > NumoAstro@... wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Hi everyone:
> > > >
> > > > I just spoke with a woman that unschools in Tucson and she said that
> in the
> > > > Pacific Northwest from Eugene, OR up through Vancouver (sp?) there is
> tons of
> > > > support for unschooling. Have any of you found that to be true in the
> areas
> > > > you live in and if so where are those areas? If there is more support
> in the
> > > > Pacific Northwest we would consider moving there (LOL)..
> > > >
> > > > Dawn F
